forumNotes.author: MedEvil
forumNotes.content:
Reading about the end of U3, got me curious to check it out before it is gone. First thing i discovered was, that all my SanDisk sticks were able to be formatted as U3 drives, eventhough non hat it installed when bought or was sporting the logo. So give it a try, you might get lucky too. Second thing i discovered was, that U3 wasn't completely working, as i thought. The hardware part i did get right, but the software(Launchpad) worked way more stupid. Hardware: Basicly a U3 drive presents itself as a USB-Hub, which has a USB-CDROM and a USB-Stick connected to it. Software: While Launchpad is installed in the write protected CDROM area, all other applications get installed into the writable area. Which makes 'sense', since it allows the apps to simply write things to the %ProgramDirectory%, instead of engineering them properly for use on a USB-Stick. :smile: But of course, this also leaves them vulnerable to any virus. Imo, while a U3 drive is a good idea, the U3 software should get replaced.
How to supercharge a U3-Stick? One creates a iso file that still fits on the stick, which contains a startmenu like PStart for instance and a whole bunch of software, which can handle running from the CDVD. (Best test this in a VM or with an image mounter.) Most, if not all, of the PortableApps.com can do that these days. Once done, the image need to get written to the U3 CDROM part. I found two programs for that. Universal Customizer 1.0.0.8. is suppose to work on any model of U3-Stick, but formats sticks bigger than 4GB still as 4GB. I've read that there exists also a patched version, which works without this bug on bigger drives. I didn't test eighter. Since both are hacked versions of a Memorex installer, no links here! If you own a SanDisk U3-Stick, you won't need it anyway. SanDisk was clever enough to integrate the functionality, to use a own iso, right into their installer. Goto SanDisk.com and download the Launchpad installer and uninstaller. Use winrar or 7zip to extract the selfextracting Launchpad installer archive to some folder. Now add two files: Start_Install.cmd and qa.ini Start_Install.cmd > @ECHO OFF > LPInstaller.exe local qa.ini > \[QA\] > LocalISOPath=.\\NaughtyPE.iso and put your iso file in the same folder. Before you ask. Yes the iso needs to named NaughtyPE.iso! ![:D](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/biggrin.png) In case there is already some iso installed on your stick, use the remove tool, before installing the new one and always unplug, after each program finished!
Like the iso name in the qa.ini might already told you, this also works for PE BootCDs. One still needs to eighter make the PE USB bootable or ramboot the PE though, but there is no hassle with fixing the PE for USB anymore. Just put the CD on the stick and be done. ![:D](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/biggrin.png) But best of all, be completely virus safe! ![:D](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/biggrin.png) Unfortunately the U3 ISO trick didn't improve the chances of the stick to get booted on my older computers, which wouldn't boot from it before. :smile:
Service notice: In case, after you're done playing, you want to reinstall Launchpad. Download: [http://u3.sandisk.co...BFG-autorun.iso](http://u3.sandisk.com/download/apps/lpinstaller/isofiles/PelicanBFG-autorun.iso "External link") and install it like the other image before. This will give you right away the latest version of Launchpad. If you do it the official way, you need to install twice, to get the latest version.

![:D](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/biggrin.png)
